segments.source_content: The previous edition was last Friday, so this one will be a bit shorter than usual. Weâ€™re resuming the usual pace of one newsletter every week after the holidays.

The [2024 edition of JS rising stars](https://risingstars.js.org/2024/en) is out, you can start by having a look at which libraries performed well on this flawed but still useful metric of GitHub starts. Spoiler: `shadcn/ui` gained the most stars (again). SÃ©bastien commented the [Tooling section](https://risingstars.js.org/2024/en#section-build).

Make sure to check our partner ğŸ—“ï¸Â [Paris TypeScript La Conf'](https://la-conf.typescript.paris/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) -Â ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·Â Paris - 28 February - Full speaker line up just dropped! JoinÂ Mateusz BurzyÅ„ski,Â Elise Patrikainen and David Rousset! Get 20% off tickets with code "TWIR"!

segments.source_content: If your authentication isn't **helping you grow**, it's **holding you back**.
With [PropelAuth](https://www.propelauth.com/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_campaign=twinrjan82024), you get everything you need to launch and scale your B2B product:

- **Easy to understand** [documentation](https://docs.propelauth.com/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_campaign=twinrjan82024) and **friendly, fast support**.
- **UIs that cover all your use cases** - signup, login, MFA, organization management and more.
- **User impersonation** so you can provide top-notch support to your users.
- **Enterprise SAML/SSO** and **advanced security features** so you can be upmarket-ready.
- **User insights** to help you strategize and expand.
Explains what Next.js is trying to accomplish, and why `â€use cacheâ€` is a compiler directive and not a function (to be able to analyze closures and determine the right cache key).
React is adding support for View transitions with a `<ViewTransition />` component that integrates with all the async features like Suspense and `startTransition`.

segments.source_content: Reactile is an UI/UX turnkey framework which features an out-of-the-box, intuitive tiling display with workspaces. It encourages parallel workloads for large web solutions within a single browser tab. Implement your own view containers, widgets and logic using React and let Reactile handle the display for you.

translations.zh-hant: Reactile æ˜¯é–‹ç®±å³ç”¨çš„ UI/UX æ¡†æ¶ï¼Œæä¾›ç›´è¦ºçš„è¦–çª—å¹³é‹ªä½ˆå±€èˆ‡å·¥ä½œå€ï¼Œé¼“å‹µåœ¨å–®ä¸€ç€è¦½å™¨åˆ†é å…§é€²è¡Œå¤§å‹ç¶²é è§£æ±ºæ–¹æ¡ˆçš„ä¸¦è¡Œå·¥ä½œè² è¼‰ã€‚æ‚¨å¯ä½¿ç”¨ React å¯¦ä½œè‡ªè¨‚è¦–çª—å®¹å™¨ã€å…ƒä»¶å’Œé‚è¼¯ï¼Œä¸¦ç”± Reactile è™•ç†é¡¯ç¤ºå±¤ã€‚

segments.source_content: On top of that, Reactile also offers:

- A promise-based persistence mechanism which permits a uniform workflow across time and on multiple devices.
- The possibility to use nested tabs for your tiles.
- A simplified global search mechanism.
- CSS @container based responsiveness.
- And much more.
